newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: CRICKET-TORRENTIAL RAIN DOWNS CUP QUARTER-FINAL.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-TORRENTIAL RAIN DOWNS CUP QUARTER-FINAL.

text.p: Torrential rain washed out the Standard Bank Cup quarter-final cricket match between Griqualand West and Northern Transvaal shortly after the first innings at Kimberley Country Club on Wednesday night.
Griquas were four without loss after just one delivery of their reply to Northerns' 237 for seven when heavy rain drove the players from the field.

Umpires David Orchard and Ravi Shah eventually abandoned the match at 9.10 p.m. with no prospect of any resumption. The match was scheduled to be replayed at the same venue from 4 p.m. on Thursday but heavy rains have endured.
Earlier, Northern Transvaal made 237 for seven from their allotted 45 overs with left-handed opener Mike Rindel top-scoring with a swashbuckling 62 off 74 balls.
Did not bat: C.English, P.Barnard, W.Dry, R.Koster, W.Bossenger, B.Benkenstein, A.Swanepoel, G.Roe, V.Walsh.
Northern Transvaal: M.Rindel, R.Pienaar, M.van Jaarsveld, S.Elworthy, R.Richardson, D.de Vos, D.Smith, D.van Zyl, M.Davis, F.de Villiers, R.Bryson.
Result: Match abandoned, due to be replayed on Thursday.
